text: Stop scrolling. What if I told you Amazon is hiring front-end engineer interns right now for a 6 month internship and yes it's paid and it's official. This video might just land your dream role at Amazon so do not click away let's dive in. So why this internship is such a big deal? Let me tell you it's a 6 months and a full-time internship at Amazon development center with a strong focus on front-end technologies like React, TypeScript and JavaScript and scalable web apps so you will get to work on real Amazon products and not just a dummy project that's why this is more than an internship it's a career launcher and ok let's look at the official listing. The role is all about front-end engineer intern and the duration is 6 months and it will be open in multiple locations such as Hyderabad, Bangalore and Gurugram and the eligibility criteria is perfectly not mentioned. Anyone who are graduating or who are studying in BTech or MTech they can apply for this and the stipend is around Rs. 40,000 to 60,000 per month and it is according to the glassdoor reports and the required skills are you must be perfect in HTML, CSS and JavaScript and React and TypeScript and Git and whoever experience with scalable systems and modern UI UX are preferred mostly. And don't just blindly click apply now here's how smart candidates apply and get noticed. Firstly create a resume tailored for front-end roles and we will get into detail next and use a strong LinkedIn profile with past projects and get referrals if possible and you must apply through the Amazon jobs portal the link is in the description you can go and check it out and prepare for online assessments in advance and now I will tell you how the resume that gets shortlisted. Let me break down this you must have projects with React or Angular and the GitHub links to live code and deployment links like Netlify and Vassal and etc and you must be aware of UI and UX designs and mention if Figma available and mention clearly of JavaScript and HTML and CSS and API integration. Now I will tell you about the assessment and interview rounds you will face technical assessment first and there will be online round and an interview and in online round you will be asked of one to two DSA questions and it will be asked from lead code and medium level questions will be asked and MCQs on JavaScript HTML CSS are mostly asked and you must be aware of UI debugging challenges and they will go through UI debugging challenges and in interview they will be asked about front-end system design and debugging session will be conducted live code walkthrough will be happens and sometimes bar raiser round will also be happened and Amazon just look at your skills and not just your college but you must stand out from that. You must do open source contributions and show consistency on GitHub and build personal projects that solve real-world problems and join front-end communities and contribute and connect and here the golden final tip Amazon loves candidates who know how things work under the hood so before the interview brush up on how React handles virtual DOM and difference between use effect and use layout effect and how to optimize rendering and writing reusable components and if you watched this far you are serious about your goals now help your friends to share this video with them and like this video if it's helped and subscribe for weekly guides on tech internships and place them preparation and resume hacks comment below if you want a resume template or mock interview video for Amazon I will reply to everyone and this is I from Beyond B Tech helping you crack the tech world one video at a time see you in the next one until then keep learning and keep going
